Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: @PTYX  retweets can be manipulated by bots -> if any better tip retweets with followers lower limit whatever is reasonable. Joining discord could also be manipulted this way, and adds no value. Tipping might be better to people having personal blogs and writing some decent articles. But make sense only if planned -> simultaneous articles similar time , like 100 a week in different blogs, media and so on. Must be coordinated. @Dr Debt  the airdrop I would suggest to split by weight of followers, meaning calculate avg weight of retweet to measure share of this 10k USD. Will be more resonable to impact and more interesting for bigger players, for whom 10k $ is still nice money for a retweet üòÉ

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: This way if 5000 people with 1 follower will do retweet and 1 person with 5000 followers, the 1 person will get 5k $  and the rest will get 1$ each, which is relevant for impact and less bot/spam-prone.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
I see

Would it be possible to make some code example? This capability was brought to us from the cryptoconditions & interoperability tech? It would fit nicely to our Komodo 5 pillar campaign.

It would be nice to highlight this with something concrete, i.e. "how to develop X on KMD"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, working on a demo game that has very simple rules so the work needed for the blockchain side is clear

Author: Audo#5667
Content: awesome!

Author: Audo#5667
Content: I have been thinking of ideas for simple games too, but they always end up becoming too complex üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it will be a simple 2 player card vs card game. At the start two players agree to the deck used, like N cards with total value of X. The the players bet a card against the other player. higher denomination wins. Owner of the card, owns the coin value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so fund cards with 1, 2, 3, ... 13 CHIPS (to represent ace high) and then each round one card is dealt by each player. at the end of the round, the results update who has what cards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: likely not a very exciting game, but should demonstrate the important parts

Author: tese#3502
Content: In the other hand, If we want to create our own games, we should have graphic designers to make the product more attractive to users
